data.title: Torque 3d crush when you import a heightmap
data.body: Torque 3d crush when you import a heightmap  in the last development src.

data.title: Terrain Macro Texture
data.body:
Adds another layer of detail-like texture to the terrain and the interface updates in the Terrain Painter.

Update: A blog post covering this change with example screenshots can be found here:  http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22194

data.title: Remove unused OOBSign from PlayGui
data.body: This HUD object was part of a feature that was never implemented in the Templates.

data.title: Resolve issue #193 - Gui Editor treeview now refreshes correctly...
data.body: ... when changed through a drag/drop operation.

data.title: Set the Ryder as the default starting weapon instead of the Lurker.
Resolve issue #163: Material Editor Crash- Opening the material editor with a mesh selected doesn't open a custom material.
data.body: Fixed a possible assert on changing material, and we now map the material to the MATMGR by name instead of type.

data.title: Thumbnails in the Material Selector do not display
data.body:
1:  Launch the game, open the World Editor, switch to the Material Editor tool.
2:  Click the browse folder button to open the Material Selector.
3:  Notice that the thumbnail previews are not displayed.

data.title: Issue for playAudio with FMOD Event
data.body:
i create and loaded FMOD Project(.fev) and Bank(.fsb) FMOD Designer.
works fine on shapebaseimage's stateSound and ExplosionData's soundProfile.

'ShapeBase.playAudio' and 'GameConnection.play3D' method don't play FMOD Event.

data.title: Updates to compile with Visual Studio 2012
reserved identifier violation
data.body:
I would like to point out that identifiers like "[`_AIPLAYER_H_`](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/7dbfe6994d2706157c1adba22fe02f26455d8687/Engine/source/T3D/aiPlayer.h#L23)" and "[`_BITVECTOR_H_`](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/88cc4129afd8e8bd6e5b7c32b5e8f5ab8f776ac6/Engine/source/core/bitVector.h#L23)" [do not fit](https://www.securecoding.cert.org/confluence/display/cplusplus/DCL32-CPP.+Do+not+declare+or+define+a+reserved+identifier#DCL32-CPPDonotdeclareordefineareservedidentifier-NoncompliantCodeExampleHeaderGuard) to the expected naming convention of the C++ language standard.
Would you like to adjust your selection for unique names?

data.title: Relocated the particles subdirectory to a more intuitive location.
Bug in GFXDrawUtil::draw2DSquare

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.title: Mapping a material using the material editor leads to bad UVS
data.body:
![exmaple](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3935254/293717/b1d0d21e-93a6-11e2-8e1c-ec4feff09bf3.jpg)
Either select a model in the mission or load one in the shape editor.  Then map a new material and the UVs on that model break (are skewed and distorted).  If the changes are saved and torque is restarted the issue goes away.

data.title: Particles are not shapes...
data.body: ... and should not be located as such.

data.title: Resolve issue #225:  Minor Issues From ParticleData Times Change
data.body:
Some default particles now have additional defaults for their times[n] array.  This resolves some console warning spam.

Issue reported:  https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/225

data.title: Filled in the variable names in autoMaterialLayers() prototype
data.body:
For clarity.

Minor whitespace formatting changes (spacing) for consistency.

data.title: Adding a basic rule-based terrain painting implementation.
data.body: http://www.garagegames.com/community/resources/view/17145

data.title: Update To Blinn/Phong
BlinnPhongFixes 21 Mar
data.body: Improved Blinn/Phong adding deeper specular control and improved shading.

data.title: Blinn/Phong Fixes
Importing terrain heightmaps flips Y-axis
data.body:
This bug has been around for ages, most recently referred to [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/107197). I fixed it in the CEV, and I've now ported my work to MIT. This time, though, the flipping is controlled by the last parameter passed to TerrainBlock::import so you could control it from the editor with a checkbox.

I don't want to add a checkbox to all four template projects' editor files. So someone else can do that, or I'll wait until the templates are refactored.

data.title: Importing terrain heightmap flips Y-axis
data.body:
ARG I didn't set the right branch. Sorry everyone.

This bug has been around for ages, most recently referred to [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/107197). I fixed it in the CEV, and I've now ported my work to MIT. This time, though, the flipping is controlled by the last parameter passed to TerrainBlock::import so you could control it from the editor with a checkbox.

I don't want to add a checkbox to all four template projects' editor files. So someone else can do that, or I'll wait until the templates are refactored.

data.title: Removing the controlsHelpDlg to reduce maintenance overhead.
data.body: Removes controlsHelpDlg.gui, the keybind to hide/display it, and the various commands to toggle it within the scripts.

data.title: Removecontrolshelpdlg
data.body: Removes controlsHelpDlg.gui, the keybind to hide/display, and the various toggle commands for it found within the scripts.

data.title: Relocate game specific GUIs  out of the "core"
data.body: Specific dlgs moved are:  chooseLevelDlg, loadingDlg, remapDlg, and optionsDlg.  The relevant art and scripts were also moved.
